episodes.title: Mental Health Stigma & The Black Church
episodes.description: On this week's episode of Surviving the Black Church Podcast, Jonathon, Hugh and Nikki embark on a journey of navigating through a very monumental topic within our community - Mental Health Stigma & The Black ChurchThis topic is so vast and so needed within our communities that the crew took a shot at covering some important themes that are necessary when discussing the state of our mental health.All of the information shared in this episode is so relevant that we decided to keep it as a whole episode. It is our longest episode to date!We encourage you to pause and reflect as much as possible as you navigate through this challenging topic with us.It is also our hope that this episode would encourage many within our community to take action to improve the quality of their mental health.Please join us now for this important discussion - Mental Health Stigma & The Black Church.If you are a part of the Black Community and would like support, feel free to join our private Facebook group -https://www.facebook.com/groups/survivingtheblackchurch  To stay up to date with our Podcast and more resources pertaining to religious trauma within the Black Church, follow us on instagram - https://www.instagram.com/survivingtheblackchurch/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y%3D  Also follow us on Twitter - @survivingtheblackchurch

episodes.title: Has religious abuse become the norm within the Black Church? - Part 2
episodes.description: On this week's episode of Surviving the Black Church Podcast, Jonathon, Hugh, and Nikki continue the conversation - Has religious abuse become the norm within the Black Church? - Part 2The normalization of religious abuse is insidious at it's core and many are suffering in silence and fear being ostracized if they speak up.This episode goes deeper and highlights an overlooked population of religious abuse survivors within the black community - adolescents. We discuss how religious abuse has impacted then and difficult it is for them to navigate the traumatic effects.This episode also discusses the negative effects of religious abuse on a survivor.Please join us for the remaining portion of "Has religious abuse become the norm within the Black Church? - Part 2If you are a part of the Black Community and would like support, feel free to join our private Facebook group -https://www.facebook.com/groups/survivingtheblackchurch  To stay up to date with our Podcast and more resources pertaining to religious trauma within the Black Church, follow us on instagram - https://www.instagram.com/survivingtheblackchurch/?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y%3D  Also follow us on Twitter - @survivingtheblackchurch

episodes.title: Church Hurt vs Religious Trauma - Part 1
episodes.description: On this week's episode of Surviving the Black Church Podcast, Jonathon, Hugh, and Nikki discuss a very important topic - Church Hurt vs Religious Trauma Part 1.Within the Black Church community, the phrase "Church Hurt" is often associated with spiritual abuse and traumatic events experienced by a survivor within the church."Church Hurt" is often used interchangeably with religious trauma or spiritual abuse. On this week's episode, the Surviving the Black Church Crew makes a clear distinction that "Church Hurt" is not the same thing as religious trauma.Is this something that you've wondered about? Have you had trouble determining if what you are experiencing may actually be religious trauma within the Black Church or church at large?If so, you don't want to miss this week's episode! It's packed with great conversation and validation for survivors who have been on this journey alone. Stay tuned for part 2 next week!Don't forget to like, share, and subscribe to our podcast!Books: https://www.joydegruy.com/product-page/copy-of-post-traumatic-slave-syndrome-softcoverIf you are a part of the Black Community and would like support, feel, free to follow us on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/groups/survivingtheblackchurchTo stay up to date with our podcast and more resources pertaining to the Black Church, follow us on instagram - https://instagram.com/survivingtheblackchurch?igshid=MjkzY2Y1YTY=Also, follow us on Twitter - @survivingtheblackchurch

episodes.title: Let's talk about Religious Trauma - Part 2
episodes.description: On this week's episode of Surviving the Black Church podcast, Jonathon, Hugh and Nikki, continued the conversation from last week - "Let's talk about Religious Trauma - Part 1".In part 2, we began an in-depth conversation describing what religious abuse and Religious trauma looks like. We also identified symptoms of trauma and soul loss within ourselves, as well as the short and long term effects of Religious Trauma.Most importantly, we encouraged and uplifted survivors of the Black Church recovering from Religious abuse and trauma.Please join us for the continuation of this important conversation "Let's talk about Religious Trauma - Part 2".Don't forget to like, share and subscribe to our Podcast!If you are a part of the Black Community and would like support, feel free to follow us on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/groups/survivingtheblackchurch.To stay up to date with our Podcast follow us on - https://instagram.com/survivingtheblackchurch?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=Also, Follow us on Twitter - @survivingtheblackchurch

episodes.title: Let's Talk About Religious Trauma - Part 1
episodes.description: On this week's episode of Surviving the Black Church podcast, entitled "Let's talk about religious trauma - Part 1", we begin to tackle this very complex subject.We discuss the positive and negative impact that religion can have on our lives. We also discuss the strong religious and Christian orientation that many in the Black Community hold.We get personal on what it's like to become aware of religious abuse and trauma within the Black Church.  We also take a deep dive on confronting various lies that hinder our ability to become aware of religious trauma within the Black Church.All of this and so much more is covered in part 1 of "Let's talk about religious trauma".Tune in to episode 1 and stay tuned for part  2 next week!Like, Share and Subscribe to our Podcast!Follow us on https://www.facebook.com/groups/survivingtheblackchurch/Follow us on https://instagram.com/survivingtheblackchurch?igshid=MjkzY2Y1YTY=Follow us on Twitter: @survivingtheblackchurch
